conclusion: Analyze forces on each segment of the triangular conductor frame in the magnetic field.
The conductor frame is an equilateral triangle with equal resistance in each segment.
Points A and B are connected to a power supply with constant voltage, causing current to flow.
Ampere force on AB segment is given as F due to interaction with the magnetic field.
Current flowing through the AB segment is I.
Current in AC and BC segments is half of that in AB segment due to symmetry.
Ampere force on AC and BC segments is F' = B * (I/2) * L = F/2.
Forces on AC and BC segments act towards the center; force on AB acts outward.
Resultant force is vector sum of forces on all segments; horizontal components cancel.
Vertical component of each force on AC and BC is (sqrt(3)/2) * (F/2).
Total vertical force is (sqrt(3)/2) * F; adding outward force on AB gives total force F.
Magnitude of resultant Ampere force on the three wires is F.
